Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    Coding representation of a Hand with 13 cards in a card game with methods for fill the hand with cards from the deck in order.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Creates an empty Hand of card with a size of 13.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fillHand(Deck deck)
      Fill the Hand with 13 cards drawn from the deck in order by suit and rank
      java.util.ArrayList orderDeck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
      Order an ArrayList of cards by rank.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Creates a String variable representation of all cards in the Hand

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand()
        Creates an empty Hand of card with a size of 13.

    • Method Detail

      • fillHand

        public void fillHand(Deck deck)
        Fill the Hand with 13 cards drawn from the deck in order by suit and rank
        Parameters:
        deck - object with cards

      • orderDeck

        public java.util.ArrayList orderDeck(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
        Order an ArrayList of cards by rank.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        ArrayList of cards ordered by rank

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a String variable representation of all cards in the Hand
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string with all cards representation in the hand.
